result.execSummary:
The defendant David Adam Losey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Defendant sentenced to 6 months consecutive in HOC; huber privileges for work and treatment.  Court recommends release for the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on Probation.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
*PROBATION CONDITIONS
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary 
*Random urine screens...no positive results
*Absolute sobriety
*No illegal drugs
*No controlled substances without prescription
*No contact with drug community
*Maintain full time employment
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge within term of probation. If not paid a civil judgment to be entered.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Adam Losey

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
( X ) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:     09-03-2014      Initials:  AAC

Defendant David Adam Losey in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 2 days served; Huber privileges for work and treatment.  Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.

Court stayed the sentence and placed defendant on probation for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:

*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*Absolute sobriety.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge within term of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant David Adam Losey in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for Danielle E Chojnacki for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.    Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 26.

As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons. Defendant shall not vote until civil rights are restored. Defendant MUST provide a DNA sample.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defendant David Adam Losey in court with attorney Robert E Haney.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Adam Losey in court with attorney Alvin Ugent for Robert E Haney.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 5/2/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant David Adam Losey in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant David Adam Losey in custody.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
